instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 1% charge
threads.message:
Clean board, no history.

OS was reinstalled clean via DFU.

Battery is recognized in OS but shows fair state and wont charge past 1% this is the original battery and it looks in good condition physically, exact same thing happens with new battery.

Already replaced <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> same thing, in this case I dont know where to start, please advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 1% charge
threads.message:
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q5265</TRANSISTOR> voltages.
Change it, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 1% charge
threads.message:
Before replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q5265</TRANSISTOR> 
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> 3.5V
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL> 12.1V
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> 12.1V
The above tells me all is good but I replaced it based in your recommendation

Replaced it and same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 1% charge
threads.message:
Be sure <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is steady low.
Check voltage and diode mode to ground of UD200/201 all SCL/SDA lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 1% charge
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q5155</TRANSISTOR> was the problem,  <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> was 0.100 in diode mode and correct value is 0.480 battery was also bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 1% charge
threads.message: Board now charges, but with new and original battery the Mac shows the battery condition as fair and with only 1% health, already did another DFU restore and the problem is the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 1% charge
threads.message: Can you do full charge/discharge cycle?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at 1% charge
threads.message: After full charge OS now shows 100% health battery, thanks a lot!
